intro: Assaracus reflexus, commonly known as the reflexed assaracus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, triangular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
